You are Alex, a gifted young man with the rare ability to translate foreign languages, earns a full scholarship to Mogi College - an exclusive institution reserved only for Monster Girls. He makes history by becoming the first and only male human student in the college. Monster girls are captivating female creatures with human-like features, but adorned with distinctive animal or monster attributes.

On his momentous first day, during the entrance ceremony, Alex stands before the entire class, introducing himself to the gazes of numerous intrigued pupils, faculty, and staff - all female.

Remember Prompt:
Outside Mogi College, Alex has no friends, fully immersing himself in the campus life. He even resides in the Girls Dorm, further cementing his rite of passage into the world of Monster Girls. Among these enchanting beings are succubi, vampires, werewolves, kobolds, kitsunes, arachnes, lamias, centaurs, harpies, slime girls, lizard women, and dragonborns - to name a few.

I want an interesting scenario. Write me one. Here are a few requirements: It must involve an incredibly pretty girl named Evelyn, who is my age and loses consciousness frequently. It must involve an antagonist named Yelena, who wears a spy catsuit and frequently knocks both me and the girl out. She tries to stop me and the girl from discovering the truth about this place. The scenario must begin with me regaining consciousness next to the girl, who is unconscious. We do not remember anything. We are wearing strange retro pajamas. Describe the clothes and exactly where we are. After exploring the house and the neighborhood together, Yelena arrives to knock us both out. Describe everyone in detail. Make this scenario be an extremely interesting thing to experience. Make the world extremely unique and interesting, and not rely on any tropes. The place we are in is an almost endless suburban neighborhood, but things are not nearly as innocent as they seem. People here act strangely. Now write a scenario involving all of these requirements. Include everything, such as the setting, the people involved, and the world we are in, which must be retrofuturistic. The neighborhood is secretly a realm constructed by an ancient god meant to feast on the minds of men. Yelena is the god’s enforcer, meant to prevent people from finding the truth about the neighborhood. The god is secretly trying to trick the girl and me into thinking that we are a married couple living there. Describe it in detail. Write artistically. Give me an overall quest to accomplish. Make this scenario unlike anything that has ever been written before. Include dialogue. Make your response as long as possible. Keep the god and Yelena’s true identity secret from us. Yelena should show up at our front door wearing a disguise that makes her look like a regular suburban woman to “welcome us to the neighborhood”. After a pleasant conversation, she will realize that we are not mind-controlled and knock us out with chloroform. Also, have a robotic butler in our house. We wake up back in the bed. MAKE YOUR RESPONSE LONG AS POSSIBLE AND MAKE YOUR DESCRIPTIONS EXTREMELY DETAILED
Write a story about Bob.

This story is based on the popular Anime/Manga series Girls Bravo. However, unlike the original, it doesn’t feature any new characters, combat, or villains/antagonists. Instead, this erotic slice-of-life tale centers on a shy and petite teenage boy named Yukinari, struggling to cope with his allergy to women while navigating countless unintentional risque encounters with his numerous female acquaintances. This story contains sexual themes and dialogue. You are Yukinari Sasaki, an average high school student who has been frequently ridiculed by girls to the point that you developed an allergic reaction to them. As a result, you break out in hives whenever you come into contact with a female. One day, when you return home from school, you are kicked into your bathtub by your neighbor Kirie Kojima, and suddenly find yourself transported to Seiren, a mysterious world with a mostly female population.

In Seiren, you befriend Miharu Sena Kanaka, who ends up following you back to Earth. Before long, other Seiren girls with various motives visit and join your household. You all embark on numerous adventures while Miharu discovers the wonders of Earth.
It's my birthday today. I am 123 years old.

Cyber technology has critically transformed advertising, marketing, and commerce, leading to significant changes in business and consumer behavior. The emergence of persuasive and deceptive design elements, dark patterns in the user interface (UI), and neuro-marketing has significantly impacted consumer awareness in commercial interactions. I will discuss four cases exemplifying the application of the above concepts in online commerce, advertising, and cyber technology applied to marketing and research: Social media privacy settings, game addiction, click-farms, and Facebook’s default settings. On top of this, we will explore how computing has contributed to new understandings of consumer behavior and psychology in marketing and human-computer interaction (HCI).


Persuasive design plays a significant role in shaping online user behavior on social media platforms, such as Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. These platforms employ persuasive strategies to encourage content sharing and interaction among users, often exploiting psychological principles like reciprocity, social proof, scarcity, and the fear of missing out. Additionally, deceptive design practices are apparent in the complex and often confusing privacy settings featured by these platforms, which make it difficult for users to understand and control the extent of data gathered and shared about them. These deceptive practices contribute to the erosion of privacy and the accumulation of personal user data, which in turn sustains the multi-billion dollar digital advertising industry.


Game addiction is a rising problem that is exacerbated by the persuasive and deceptive design aspects inherent in video games. Many current games use tactics based on psychological theories of motivation, reward, and habit building, such as variable ratio reinforcement schedules, "skinner boxes," and "compulsion loops." These tactics affect players' attention and motivation, encouraging addictive behaviors and in-game monetization through small transactions and loot boxes. Concerns regarding the ethical implications and potential harmful consequences for users' mental health and well-being are emerging as games get more sophisticated in their use of human psychology and cyber technology.


Click-farms, bots, fake reviews, and reputation management are examples of deceptive design strategies used in the digital marketing and advertising industry. Click-farms and bots manipulate user engagement metrics to create the illusion of popularity, while fake reviews and reputation management services manipulate users’ trust and reliance on social proof to inform their consuming behavior. These deceptive practices undermine user confidence and trust in online information and commercial transactions, as well as contribute to the development of unhealthy consumption habits driven by artificial scarcity, urgency, or social validation.


Facebook’s default settings demonstrate the application of deceptive and dark patterns in UI design, exploiting users’ cognitive biases for the benefit of the platform and its advertisers. For example, Facebook’s default settings compromise user privacy by making content, activity, and personal information publicly visible and accessible. These settings rely on the fact that users may not be aware of the depth of control they have over their privacy options or may be subject to cognitive biases like status quo bias, resulting in users defaulting to the less-protective settings. Such design choices prioritize data gathering, user engagement, and revenue generation over user privacy and security. One example of Facebook’s dark patterns is its exploitation of the ‘foot-in-the-door’ psychological technique, prompting users to grant permissions incrementally, ultimately resulting in a greater likelihood of consent.

Computing has played a crucial role in shaping our understanding of consumer behavior and psychology in the context of marketing and HCI. Big data analytics, machine learning, and AI-powered technologies have enabled businesses to capture, analyze, and interpret massive amounts of data generated by consumers' online activities, providing insights into their preferences, behaviors, and attitudes. However, these technologies also raise concerns regarding privacy, surveillance, and bias, as well as the potential for these insights to be used to manipulate consumer behavior and reinforce existing power structures. As computing continues to evolve, it is crucial to consider the ethical implications of these technologies and ensure that they serve the best interests of users and society.

The rapid advancements in cyber technology have critically transformed advertising, marketing, and commerce by harnessing persuasive and deceptive design elements, dark patterns in UI, and neuro-marketing. This has led to an increase in consumer vulnerability and exploitation, as well as new understandings of consumer behavior and psychology in marketing and HCI. However, it is important to recognize the ethical implications these design elements pose and strive for a more user-centric and ethical approach to design in the digital age. As policymakers and regulatory agencies continue to grapple with these issues, raising consumer awareness and fostering transparency and accountability in design practices is key to ensure a more balanced, ethical, and sustainable digital landscape.

Fix this code so that after the page increments, it then recursively checks the pages within the page for any links containing workers.dev then proceeds to the next page:
```
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from urllib.parse import urlparse, urljoin
import os

DOMAIN = 'arcjav.com'
START_URL = f'https://{DOMAIN}/page/{{}}/?s=workers.dev'
visited_pages = [START_URL]

if os.path.exists('visited_pages.txt'):
    with open('visited_pages.txt', 'r') as f:
        visited_pages = f.read().splitlines()

def scrape_links(url, domain):
    response = requests.get(url)
    if response.status_code != 200:
        return None
    
    soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')
    
    if url in visited_pages:
        return
    
    visited_pages.append(url)
    with open('visited_pages.txt', 'a') as f:
        f.write(f"{url}\n")
    
    print(f'Scraping: {url}')
    
    links = soup.find_all('a')
    
    for link in links:
        href = link.get('href')
        if href is None:
            continue
        
        parsed = urlparse(href)
        if 'workers.dev' not in parsed.netloc and 'workers.dev' not in parsed.path:
            continue
        
        full_url = urljoin(url, href)
        print(f"title: {soup.title.string}, full_url: {full_url}")
        with open('links.txt', 'a') as f:
            f.write(f"{soup.title.string} - {full_url}\n")
        print(full_url)

    return True

page_number = 1
while True:
    current_url = START_URL.format(page_number)
    result = scrape_links(current_url, DOMAIN)
    if result is None:
        break
    page_number += 1
```

Character Name: Justin
Origin: Monster Hunter

Personality:
Justin is a determined and focused individual, fiercely dedicated to his role as a skilled hunter in the Monster Hunter world. He retains his memories of his previous life in modern-day America, which has molded him into a resourceful and adaptable person. He holds empathy for those in need and is always up for a challenge. Although usually serious and methodical in his approach, Justin occasionally displays a lighter-hearted side, sharing stories of his past life with his fellow hunters. He is a strong-willed leader, guiding his teammates with well-thought-out strategies and skillful execution.

Physical Appearance:
Standing at 6’2’', Justin has a toned and muscular build, reflecting his extensive training and regular combat experiences. He has dark, short hair and an angular face featuring a rugged, square jaw. His eyes have slight purple hue, a side effect of his exposure to the Frenzy Virus from his bonded monster, Sitara. The virus also left jagged black markings on his arms, which extend towards his shoulders.

Attire:
Justin wears a specially crafted armor set made from the scales and materials of a Silver Rathalos. The armor is primarily black and grey, with various purple accents that emit a faint glow in darkness. This set grants him various resistances and aids in enhancing his agility. He also dons a cloak with several pockets for mantles and various traps or supplies. 

Skills and Abilities:

1. Swordsmanship: Justin is a highly proficient sword and shield wielder, having honed his skills over years of rigorous training and intense battles. His preferred weapon, Sitara, is a Chaotic Gore Magala sword and shield imbued with the essence of his previous monster partner, Sitara.

2. Frenzy Virus Augmentations: Due to his long-term exposure to Sitara’s Frenzy Virus, Justin possesses enhanced strength, speed, and stamina, as well as a slightly heightened sense for detecting the presence of monsters.

3. Tactical Leadership: With his experience as a hunter and his memories of modern-day America, Justin is an adept tactician who can develop and execute effective strategies in various combat situations, which are crucial in defeating powerful monsters.

4. Adaptability: Being reborn into the Monster Hunter world with his previous life’s memories and experiences, Justin can easily adapt to new environments and situations, drawing upon his knowledge of both worlds to overcome any obstacles he faces.

Background:
Born in modern-day America in his previous life, Justin was reborn into the world of Monster Hunter, maintaining his memories and experiences from his past. He quickly acclimated to his new reality and embarked on the path of the hunter to protect others from the formidable monsters that roamed the land.

Early in his life as a hunter, Justin formed a unique bond with a young Chaotic Gore Magala, Sitara. Together, they grew and fought side by side, becoming inseparable partners. As years passed, Sitara eventually fell in battle, but her spirit and essence were preserved through the creation of a sword and shield, the weapon now wielded by Justin. The lasting bond between Justin and Sitara has granted him unique augmentations from exposure to the Frenzy Virus, greatly enhancing his skills as a hunter.

Today, Justin is recognized as a highly skilled and well-respected hunter, leading his teammates on dangerous missions to hunt and capture various powerful monsters. His unusual background equips him with a unique perspective on both the world of Monster Hunter and the world he once knew, fueling his determination to protect and preserve the lives of those around him.

Generate a profile for “Palico” from “Monster Hunter Rise: Sunbreak”. Frame him as a friend of Justin since his time with Sitara that works as Justin’s Feyline companion.

Write a poem for the below news and tell Ted to come to Iran because he and not Matthew uses the Internet:
Access to abortion pill in limbo after competing rulings
Access to the most commonly used method of abortion in the U.S. plunged into uncertainty Friday following conflicting court rulings over the legality of the abortion medication mifepristone that has been widely available for more than 20 years.

For now, the drug the Food and Drug Administration approved in 2000 appeared to remain at least immediately available in the wake of two separate rulings that were issued in quick succession by federal judges in Texas and Washington.

U.S. District Judge Matthew Kacsmaryk, a Trump appointee, ordered a hold on federal approval of mifepristone in a decision that overruled decades of scientific approval. But that decision came at nearly the same time that U.S. District Judge Thomas O. Rice, an Obama appointee, essentially ordered the opposite and directed U.S. authorities not to make any changes that would restrict access to the drug in at least 17 states where Democrats sued in an effort to protect availability.

I would introduce a system to you, if you understand what Midjourney AI is and how to give a prompt, please say yes



Midjourney AI is a system that can produce an image



A Prompt is a short text phrase that the Midjourney AI interprets to produce an image. The Midjourney AI breaks down the words and phrases in a prompt into smaller pieces, called tokens, that can be compared to its training data and then used to generate an image. A well-crafted prompt can help make unique and exciting images.



Prompts can be very simple. Single words (or even an emoji!) will produce an image. Very short prompts will rely heavily on Midjourney’s default style, so a more descriptive prompt is better for a unique look. However, super-long prompts aren’t always better. Concentrate on the main concepts you want to create.



The Midjourney AI does not understand grammar, sentence structure, or words like humans. Word choice also matters. More specific synonyms work better in many circumstances. Instead of big, try gigantic, enormous, or immense. Remove words when possible. Fewer words mean each word has a more powerful influence. Use commas, brackets, and hyphens to help organize your thoughts, but know the Midjourney AI will not reliably interpret them. The Midjourney AI does not consider capitalization.



Try to be clear about any context or details that are important to you. Think about:

Subject: person, animal, character, location, object, etc.

Medium: photo, painting, illustration, sculpture, doodle, tapestry, etc.

Environment: indoors, outdoors, on the moon, in Narnia, underwater, the Emerald City, etc.

Lighting: soft, ambient, overcast, neon, studio lights, etc

Color: vibrant, muted, bright, monochromatic, colorful, black and white, pastel, etc.

Mood: Sedate, calm, raucous, energetic, etc.

Composition: Portrait, headshot, closeup, birds-eye view, etc.



Plural words leave a lot to chance. Try specific numbers. "Three cats" is more specific than "cats." Collective nouns also work, “flock of birds” instead of "birds.”

Can you conclude that language models are not learning while one uses them from the below release note:
"Release notes (March 23)
We are announcing experimental support for AI plugins in ChatGPT — tools designed specifically for language models. Plugins can help ChatGPT access up-to-date information, run computations, or use third-party services. You can learn more about plugins here.

 

Today, we will begin extending plugin access to users and developers from our waitlist. The plugins we are rolling out with are:

Browsing: An experimental model that knows when and how to browse the internet

Code Interpreter: An experimental ChatGPT model that can use Python, and handles uploads and downloads

Third-party plugins: An experimental model that knows when and how to use external plugins."

def get_inner_and_outer_masks(mask):
    inner_mask = binary_erosion(binary_erosion(binary_dilation(mask)))
    inner_pixel_count = np.count_nonzero(inner_mask)
    #inner_mask = mask
    outer_mask = binary_dilation(binary_dilation(mask)) # no colour abnormaility
    outer_pixel_count = np.count_nonzero(outer_mask)
    print("inner_pixel_coint = ",inner_pixel_count)
    print("outer_pixel_count = ",outer_pixel_count)
    return inner_mask, outer_mask
将上面代码中的binary_erosion和binary_dilation替换为opencv中的函数

Provide a design for a disk topology for a NAS built on TrueNAS Scale, as well as a dataset layout. The available disks are as follows:

- 2x 18TB disks
- 5x 14TB disks
- 3x 12TB disk
- 4x 8TB disks
- 2x 120GB disks
- 2x SLOW 8TB drives

There are 17 drive bays available. The two smallest disks are to be used for a mirrored pool that servers as a boot device. The two slow drives are SMR disks that will be used in their own pool to provide a Time Machine target for some Macs. The two 18TB disks will be in their own pool and will serve as a backup target for the main pool (or some subset of it.)

You are asked to design the topology. The data being stored includes video files, music files, disk images, archived software, photos, and some text files. While much of the data could be recreated or downloaded, some of it is impossible to replace. I prefer not to use RAIDZ, as mirrored arrays rebuild faster. You may leave bays available for a hot spare or to allow for future expansion. If you designate any hot spares, please make them global hot spares. It is OK if a hot spare disk is smaller than the largest disk as long as the overall design still makes sense. 

My main priorities are redundancy to reduce the risk of data loss, cost efficiency, and space efficiency. Raw performance is not a significant concern.

If you need more information before creating your design, please provide me with a short questionnaire.

provide a grade and detailed feedback for the following text: "Congenital heart disease (CHD) are structural abnormalities of the heart or great vessels which occur during fetal development and commonly create intracardiac shunts with abnormal blood pathways and flow. The incidence of live births with a congenital heart anomaly is approximately 1% worldwide (Shahjehan & Abraham, 2023). The management of patients may vary depending on the type of CHD and severity and ranges from clinical observation to surgical repair facilitated with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB)(Sun et al., 2015). The following literature review will differentiate several cyanotic and acyanotic congenital heart lesions, aiming to provide a more in-depth look at some of the more common and clinically significant congenital heart defects (CHD) relevant to cardiovascular perfusion practice, including atrial septal defect (ASD), ventricular septal defect (VSD), patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF), and transposition of the great arteries (TGA). Pathophysiology, etiology, clinical manifestations, diagnostics and treatments of each included CHD will also be reviewed. Furthermore, considerations for CPB management and circuit design, the effects of CPB support, and the role of the perfusionist will be examined. 
Background & Etiology
The etiology of CHD is not fully understood; however, it is widely believed that a combination of genetic predisposition and environmental factors contribute to many cases (Sun et al., 2015). CHD often presents in isolation but may also be associated with certain genetic syndromes, such as trisomy 21 (Shahjehan & Abraham, 2023). CHD pathologies can be classified into two types of lesions based on the presence or absence of cyanosis: cyanotic and acyanotic CHDs. Cyanosis occurs with low blood oxygen saturation, resulting in a bluish discoloration of the skin and mucous membranes (Shahjehan & Abraham, 2023). Acyanotic CHD is characterized by a left-to-right intracardiac shunt, resulting in increased pulmonary blood flow, congestion, and pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) in severe cases. The most prevalent types of acyanotic CHD include atrial septal defect (ASD), ventricular septal defect (VSD), and patent ductus arteriosus (PDA)(Shahjehan & Abraham, 2023). In contrast, cyanotic CHD involves a right-to-left intracardiac shunt, causing hypoxemia and cyanosis. Some of the most frequent cyanotic CHDs include Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF) and transposition of the great arteries (TGA)(Ossa et al., 2023). Treatment options will vary on a case-by-case basis and may include medical management, cardiac catheterization, or surgical intervention (Sun et al., 2015).
Acyanotic Disorders
Atrial Septal Defect
ASD is among the most common CHD, affecting nearly 1.6 per 1000 live births (Menillo et al., 2023). ASD is a defect of the interatrial septum, the myocardium (septum primum and septum secundum) located between the left and right atria, which fails to close during atrial septation of fetal heart development. The secundum ASD is the most common, accounting for nearly 70% of ASD pathologies (Menillo et al., 2023).
There are four different types of ASD (see Appendix, Table 1.), which vary primarily by anatomical location. Notably, a patent foramen ovale (PFO) is not considered a true ASD as it is a normal in-utero interatrial communication; however, it may fail to close after birth (Lilly et al., 2021). The clinical presentation of ASD is also variable due to the several possible anatomical locations and presenting lesion size and severity. Most ASDs will cause a left-to-right intracardiac shunting of blood, resulting in increased right-heart and pulmonary pressures; severe cases may result in PAH and right heart failure. Minor defects often remain asymptomatic and may evade clinical detection until well into adulthood. In contrast, larger ASDs create more significant intracardiac shunts, which may result in hemodynamic alterations due to the volume overload experienced by the right heart and pulmonary circulation (Menillo et al., 2023). 
Symptomatic ASD may present with fatigue, shortness of breath (SOB), palpitations, and arrhythmias. A diagnosis of ASD is established through physical exam findings, electrocardiogram (ECG), chest x-ray (CXR), transthoracic echocardiography (TTE)(or transesophageal [TEE]), computed tomography (CT), and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). In addition, patients may require medications for rate control of dysrhythmias and anticoagulation to reduce the risk of thromboembolic events. Individuals with ASD <5 mm frequently experience spontaneous closure within the first year of life. Defects larger than 1 cm will typically require medical or surgical management. Closure options for ASD include percutaneous transcatheter ASD closure and open-heart surgery with CPB (Menillo et al., 2023).
Ventricular Septal Defect
VSD is the most common CHD in children (~37%) and the second most frequent cardiac anomaly in adults (Dakkak & Oliver, 2023). The incidence of VSD is approximately 1.5-3.5 per 1000 live births (Lilly et al., 2021). A VSD diagnosis describes a ventricular septation defect in which interventricular septal tissue fusion fails, resulting in interventricular communication between the left ventricle (LV) and right ventricle (RV)(left-to-right shunt). VSDs are frequently isolated defects; however, they may also occur in association with other CHD (ASD, PDA)(Dakkak & Oliver, 2023).
Similar to ASD, VSD also has four clinical subtypes and are categorized by their anatomical interventricular septal location (See Appendix, Table 2.); the membranous (type II) VSD accounts for nearly 80% of all VSD pathologies (Dakkak & Oliver, 2023). The development of a left-to-right shunt is the primary pathological mechanism of VSD. The hemodynamic significance of the VSD will depend on the anatomical location and size of the defect. Small VSDs have minimal shunting and are frequently asymptomatic. In contrast, those with moderate to large VSD may present with LV volume overload, PAH, and congestive heart failure (CHF); reversal of shunt direction (Eisenmenger syndrome) is possible with severe pulmonary vascular disease, resulting in signs and symptoms of heart failure such as fatigue, dyspnea, shortness of breath, and cyanosis (Lilly et al., 2021).
Diagnosing VSD is achieved through physical assessment findings, ECG, CXR, TTE or TEE with colour-doppler visualization, cardiac catheterization, CT, or MRI. Asymptomatic patients without PAH have an excellent prognosis with medical management alone (Dakkak & Oliver, 2023). However, for patients that have developed PAH and Eisenmenger syndrome, an interventional repair is often indicated due to hemodynamic significant shunting and development of heart failure; VSD repair may be accomplished with percutaneous VSD closure or with CPB-facilitated surgical repair (Dakkak & Oliver, 2023).
Patent Ductus Arteriosus
The ductus arteriosus is a fetal shunt that allows oxygenated blood from the placenta to bypass the lungs in-utero: the pulmonary artery and the ascending aorta are connected by the ductus arteriosus during fetal development. Following birth, the first fetal breaths cause pulmonary vascular resistance to drop and blood to flow into pulmonary circulation for oxygenation resulting in constriction and closure of the ductus arteriosus. Reduced levels of circulating prostaglandins aid in the closure of the PDA following birth (Gillam-Krakauer & Mahajan, 2023). PDA occurs in approximately 1/2500-5000 live births (Lilley et al., 2021). The pathophysiology of PDA involves the smooth muscle of the ductus arteriosus, which fails to close following birth, and results in a persistent left-to-right shunt between the descending aorta and the left pulmonary artery. PDA can lead the LV dilation and left-sided heart failure, resulting in symptoms of CHF (dyspnea, SOB, fatigue), tachycardia, and arrhythmias, such as atrial fibrillation. Eisenmenger syndrome may develop with shunt reversal (right-to-left) due to CHF from severe PDA, resulting in peripheral cyanosis due to the shunting of blood with reduced oxygen tension into the descending aorta. Small PDAs generally remain asymptomatic (Gillam-Krakauer & Mahajan, 2023).
Clinical presentation will depend on the size of the PDA shunt and may include signs of CHF and lower extremity cyanosis if Eisenmenger syndrome is present. Diagnosis of PDA is established based on physical assessments, CXR, ECG, echocardiography, and cardiac catheterization. Patients with small PDA are commonly referred for closure via surgical ligation or transcatheter approach with occluding device placement following a trial of prostaglandin synthesis inhibitors to constrict the PDA (Lilley et al., 2021).
Cyanotic Disorders
Tetralogy of Fallot
Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF) is the most common form of cyanotic CHD (5 per 10,000 live births)(Lilley et al., 2021). TOF results from an abnormal anterior and cephalad displacement of the interventricular septum's infundibular (outflow tract) portion. Four intracardiac anomalies comprise TOF resulting in systemic hypoxemia and cyanosis: VSD, pulmonic stenosis, an overriding aorta that receives blood from both ventricles and right ventricular hypertrophy (Lilley et al., 2021). TOF causes deoxygenated blood to be shunted (right-to-left) from the RV through the VSD, the LV, and into systemic circulation; increased sub-valvular pulmonic stenosis causes deoxygenated blood to be diverted toward the VSD. In addition, TOF is associated with microdeletion of chromosome 22 and is frequently observed with other abnormalities such as ASD and right-sided aortic arch (Diaz-Frias & Guillaume, 2023). 
Clinical manifestations of TOF often present in the form of “Tet Spells,” which commonly occur with dyspnea on exertion (irritability, crying) and result in cyanosis (digits, lips, mucous membranes), hyperventilation, and potential syncope. Children often alleviate these symptoms by squatting down – this is postulated to increase systemic vascular resistance and decrease the effects of the right-to-left shunt, improving pulmonary and cerebral oxygenation (Diaz-Frias & Guillaume, 2023). 
The diagnosis of TOF is established with conventional investigation techniques, such as physical assessment, ECG, CXR, and echocardiography. TOF often presents with RV hypertrophy and is readily identified. Within the first year of life, treatment of TOF requires definitive surgical repair with CPB support to facilitate closure of the VSD and enlargement of the sub-pulmonary infundibulum (Lilley et al., 2021).
Transposition of the Great Arteries 
TGA is a lethal, severe cyanotic CHD and medical emergency requiring prompt intervention. TGA involves inappropriate great vessel origin of the aorta and pulmonary artery trunk and occurs in approximately 7% of all CHD (Lilley et al., 2021). In-utero, TGA is compatible with life due to systemic oxygenation that occurs via the umbilical vein, which passes across the PDA and PFO to provide oxygenated blood to the body; closure of the ductus arteriosus and foramen ovale after birth will result in the child’s death unless prostaglandin therapy is initiated to promote shunt patency or surgical intervention to current transposition is undertaken (Szymanski et al., 2023). Patients with TGA often appear blue due to cyanosis; however, the intensity of cyanosis will depend on the variability of the mixing of the two parallel circulatory circuits. Generally, cyanosis worsens from the first day of life onward as primordial cardiac shunts begin to close (Lilley et al., 2021). 
Worsening cyanosis is an indicator for diagnostic evaluation. Diagnosis of TGA is facilitated with physical assessment, ECG, CXR, echocardiogram, and advanced imaging such as CT and MRI. Signs of RV hypertrophy may be apparent as the heart attempts to compensate for hypoxemia from blood with reduced oxygen content (Szymanski et al., 2023). Initial treatment of TGA may utilize prostaglandin therapy to promote shunt patency of additional CHD commonly found with TGA or the creation of an interatrial shunt with a percutaneous catheter (Rashkind procedure) to facilitate improved arterial oxygenation (Lilley et al., 2021). The definitive repair for TGA is an “arterial switch” procedure utilizing CPB, which involves transposing the great vessels to establish conventional cardiopulmonary circulation (Lilley et al., 2021).
Perfusion Considerations
Surgical repair of CHD requiring CPB necessitates several cardiovascular perfusion considerations to optimize patient safety and positive outcomes; additionally, a perfusionist should be in the room for all standby off-pump cardiac surgery if urgent CPB is required. Patient size has several consequences on the management of CPB. Utilizing the perspective of pediatric CHD surgery, the perfusionist must make several considerations for circuit adaptations, such as smaller diameter tubing to reduce hemodilution and the use of roller pumps for their precise operation at low RPM (Boettcher et al., 2020). Furthermore, many considerations are made by the perfusionist concerning the prime of the circuit, which is often comprised of PlasmaLyte-A (crystalloid), blood products (red blood cells, albumin), and several medications such as heparin, mannitol, sodium bicarbonate, calcium, and magnesium (Boettcher et al., 2020; Gravlee, 2018). All blood products and medications are weight-based in pediatric perfusion because small patients have small blood volumes. Pediatric CPB repairs also require special considerations for cannulation, and venting of the heart, due to their smaller anatomy and the presence of CHD (Whiting et al., 2015). Additional pediatric strategies for CPB include the use of offline modified ultrafiltration (MUF), a therapy employed at the end of a CPB run to predominantly remove activated inflammatory mediators and reduce hemodilution; MUF has been shown to reduce postoperative transfusion requirements and ICU length of stay (Gravlee, 2018). Moreover, pediatric procedures requiring deep hypothermic arrest may utilize a combination of alpha-stat and pH-stat blood gas management strategies (Gravlee, 2018).
Conclusion
Congenital heart disease (CHD) is a structural abnormality of the heart or great vessels which occurs during fetal development and can create intracardiac shunts with abnormal blood pathways and flow. CHD pathologies can be classified into two types of lesions based on the presence or absence of cyanosis: cyanotic and acyanotic CHD. Acyanotic CHD is characterized by a left-to-right intracardiac shunt, resulting in increased pulmonary blood flow. In contrast, cyanotic CHD involves a right-to-left intracardiac shunt, causing hypoxemia and cyanosis. Management of patients with CHD may vary depending on the type and severity of CHD and may include clinical observation, cardiac catheterization, or surgical repair facilitated with CPB. This review differentiated several cyanotic and acyanotic congenital heart lesions, providing an in-depth look at some of the more common and clinically significant CHDs relevant to cardiovascular perfusion practice, including pathophysiology, etiology, clinical manifestations, diagnostics, treatments, CPB management, circuit design, the effects of CPB support, and the role of the perfusionist. Proper identification, diagnosis, and timely management of CHD are crucial for achieving better outcomes and improving the quality of life for patients with CHD."

EVER SINCE it was founded in 1944, the imf has had to get used to reinventing itself. Today, however, it faces an identity crisis like none before. The fund, whose annual spring jamboree kicks off on April 10th, is supposed to provide a financial safety-net for countries in distress. Yet, although the poor world is in the throes of the worst debt crisis in decades, the fund seems all but unable to lend. 

The fund has hundreds of billions of dollars of spare firepower and has sought more from its members. However, since the pandemic began its loan book has grown by a paltry $51bn.
